children.value: Diseases like these are not the only threat to bee populations. The use of pesticides and herbicides, as well as the growing urban sprawl, all have detrimental effects. Although, the extinction of bees would not lead to famine—since most cereal crops are wind-pollinated, the majority of fruits and vegetables are insect-pollinated and without bees these would have to be pollinated manually, or by robots—which is unlikely to happen in Sri Lanka anytime soon. Crops that are not cost-effective to hand or robot-pollinate, would likely be lost
